morphology.notes: The doubling emphasizes personal engagement; the cohortative nuance invites a journey of trust.

exegetical_notes: Imperative is followed by paragogic pronoun stressing Abram's obedience with personal cost.
Threefold blessing structure (nation, name, universal blessing) frames covenant mission.
lexical_insights: ברך occurs five times in the pericope, creating an inclusio of blessing.
The piel stem intensifies the blessing promise—God as active blesser.

morphology.notes: Imperfect verbal form conveys ongoing presence rather than static name.

exegetical_notes: The narrative uses the verb ראה in a chiastic pattern to spotlight divine initiative.
Moses' objections climax in verse 11, answered by covenantal assurance (אֶהְיֶה).
lexical_insights: The noun עֲנִי occurs earlier to highlight Israel's oppression, juxtaposed with divine compassion.
Mountain imagery (חֹרֵב) anticipates later covenant scenes (Exodus 19).

morphology.part_of_speech: Qal participle masculine singular of רעה
morphology.notes: Participle portrays habitual action—the Lord continually shepherds.

exegetical_notes: Alternation between third-person description and second-person address indicates intimacy.
Verbal sequence (יִרְבִּיצֵנִי, יַנְחֵנִי, יְשׁוֹבֵב) conveys movement from rest to guidance to restoration.
lexical_insights: The valley phrase גֵּיא צַלְמָוֶת combines 'shadow' and 'death' to describe intense threat.
The verb רדף (pursue) is reversed—goodness and mercy chase the psalmist.
